info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 4:05PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN CUSTER...SOUTHWESTERN CARTER AND POWDER RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 404 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles west of Volborg to 21 miles southeast of Ashland to 21 miles north of Spotted Horse. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broadus, Volborg, Biddle, Olive, Sonnette, Hammond, Moorhead, Powderville, Boyes, Belle Creek, and Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
